title: Tis better a protector, when camera hole to collect dust it has not
text:
[[Impressions]]

I bought this screen protector because a previous one I had with a camera hole was collecting a ton of dust in the camera hole cutout. Since the hole is so small it's really difficult to clean out and makes selfie shots a bit washed out. This one doesn't have the hole, so you won't have this problem, and I can't tell any difference in quality in the selfie camera. Even if the glass reduces light to the camera, it's still probably a lot better than with the dust. It's also easier to install because you don't need to line up the camera hole cutout since there is none. I also didn't get any bubbles that I couldn't press out.

[[What's Inside]

The package comes with three sets of 1) screen protector, 2) wet and dry wipes, and 3) a dust sticker and 2 guide stickers.

[[Build Quality]]

I did notice some issues with this screen protector. One side (right side when removal sticker tab is facing up and down) always caused a large rainbow fringe to show up on my screen even though the edge of the screen protector went past the screen. I had to offset that side significantly to remove the issue. Some of the protectors also had chips on that side that were distracting. The screen protector is actually a safety glass laminate so I'm guessing the machinery might need to be refurbished at the factory. I tried another brand of screen protector that didn't have a camera hole and had the same issues though. Thankfully, Ailun's customer service was excellent and they shipped me a new set of protectors and I was able to choose the one with the least rainbowing.

[[My Install Guide]]

To install, I suggest running a hot shower with the shower door/curtain open. Let the room steam up and remove any towels or anything that can create lint from the bathroom. Outside the shower, wipe the protector as it might have some sharp glass bits leftover from the cutting process. Wipe and dry your phone. Align the protector with the screen of the phone, then tape the protector to the phone so that it forms a hinge. I had to use a lot of tape as the tape doesn't stick well to the protector. Put some more tape along the other edge of the protector to act as a flap. Move into the shower room, flip open the hinged screen protector, and then clean the screen one last time. Use the included stickers to stick the entire screen once over to remove any dust. Once you see that there's no dust, quickly remove the protective clear sticker from the screen protector and flip it onto the phone screen. Press out any remaining bubbles. Use a flashlight or turn the screen brightness up to check for dust, and if you see any, carefully lift up the screen and use a sticker to stick away the dust which should be stuck to the bottom of the protector. There should be very little dust since you are in the steamy room. The protector should be slightly wet underneath due to the steam, so you can probably slide it around slightly to get the last bit of alignment. With this method, you won't have to spend hours attaching the protector and getting rid of dust.

title: Great customer service and good product
text: I had some issues installing my first set of screen protectors due to there being too much dust in my room.  The sticker was also harder to remove from the glass so a bit more fidgeting was involved and that probably added to the dust.  However, OMOTON was able to quickly send me a replacement free of charge (!!) and I was able to attach that one.  I definitely suggest you try to install in a steamy room like your bathroom.

title: Good fit.  Relatively easy install.
text:
General Thoughts:

The fit is true to the phone (Revvl 4+). With a case (Sucnakp brand), this protector is about 1-2mm from the edge of the case on all sides. I like that the plastic film on the protector comes off very easily compared to other brands - this makes applying the protector fast and avoids dust. They are also very generous and include 3 microfiber towels that are thicker and larger than others I've used. Finally, the glass itself seems to be higher quality with nice rounded edges. Touch sensitivity is fine and the feeling is the same as the original screen. The only thing they could improve on would be to include an alignment frame like some other brands.

How I Applied:

I wasted one screen protector when installing due to dust but the second one turned out well. I cleaned my screen and the protector with the included alcohol wipe and microfiber towel. Make sure to wipe the protector as it might scratch the phone in the next step. I lined up the protector with the phone and then taped it onto the phone like a hinge using the included stickers. Then I wiped the phone again and then used the included stickers to thoroughly remove all dust from the screen. Once all the dust was gone, I quickly unpeeled the protective plastic from the protector and flipped it onto the screen. You have to do this last step fast to avoid dust. I had to lift the corner of the screen slightly to remove some remaining dust particles but otherwise it came out very well.

title: OK for a Smart Unlocked GSM smartphone but the camera is absolutely USELESS!
text:
This is an OK phone. Prior to having this phone, I used to have a Huawei Elate I bought from Bestbuy a month ago for $50.00. Let me tell you that Huawei phone is actually more phone than I needed and I was really happy with it and I can't believe I snagged a good phone for less than a $100.00. About 2 weeks after this, I showed my coordinator my Huawei phone and he said, “Great phone made in China right?” And I said yeah to which my coordinator said,” You know...these Chinese made smartphones are made with a backdrop built right in right?” I said what do you mean?

To which he said “Oh yeah, they made this phones with backdoors...To SPY on you as the owner your accounts and hack through your personal information”. This discussion with my coordinator really disturbed me to the point that I went researching on google that night IF my coordinator was just pulling my leg/bluffing me or there's really something serious to what he said. Then 30 minutes later BOOM! And there it was for all it's glory and he was right. Immediately after finding this facts out, I went immediately to amazon to get a smartphone to replace this Chinese made James Bond phone to avoid being spied on so I stumbled upon this phone. Still not happy, I went to YouTube to get reviews about this phone about it's pros and cons and the Bloggers were adamant that this phone is good and bang for the money so I ordered one.

2 days later I got and immediately inserted my Cricket Wireless SIM card and It worked instantly. On top of this, I bought this on amazon on a installment payments about $38.00 per month and only 4 payments left to pay. This smartphone happened to have way way more bells and whistle function more than the Huawei phone I bought like fingerprint I.D.detection, facial recognition and Alexa help and I'm very happy with it. Anything Cons about this phone? The phone is twitchy at best and unusable at worst! The worst thing about the camera is that it ALWAYS SAY, "Camera error...Restart the Camera" every single time you use it! title: Amazing, small phone that's fast and easy to use
text:
Before the Pearl, I was using the blackberry 7100t, with Tmobile. The 7100t is big and bulky, and it was a bit slow, but I loved having my email with my phone. What I wanted was something that looked like a regular phone, but had blackberry functionality. The pearl is a dream come true -- it's sleek, thin, a beautiful and comfortable phone, top quality reception, and it even has an MP3 player.

The main appeal here is if you want blackberry email capabilities but also have a regular looking phone. One other thing is that blackberry has the best international coverage (on GSM carriers), better than any other email system, so anywhere you go in the world, you've got your email and phone working with no problem.

The pearl is especially fast, it's got an intel 312mhz processor, much faster than the tmobile dash and some of the other phones on the market. The keyboard takes getting used to, but it works quite well. It's not for typing long emails, but I think no matter what you need a computer for long documents or emails.

This is the phone if you don't want something bulky but don't want emails to pile up that you could quickly respond to throughout the day. Blackberry email is the easiest to set up, it works the best, and this a fantastic and fast phone overall.

title: Great but has some caveats
text:
[[VIDEOID:31a74f2743f23eb0aec4a9db9cecd680]] I really like the portrait and landscape mode. It is something that my last gimbal couldn't do and being able to switch between the two modes with a button press is really nice. The magnetic mount is a nice feature and makes it easy to take the phone off and tuck it into a pocket when moving from location to location. This makes the process less fiddly since you can do it before you go out to take pictures and videos. One of the weird things I noticed is that pictures taken through the app seem to be geo tagged in the ocean of the coast of China. This is weird and I'm not sure how to correct this. I can only assume it's baked into the software somewhere, but odd nevertheless.
Some negatives, at least when using an S10E or other android phone, the app is not available on the Google play store. The inability to download the app easily is a big con as it makes updates and initial use more difficult. If you're not familiar with allowing APK downloads from internet sources then this alone might be enough to deter you. I have another Chinese made gimbal and their app is their so I feel like DJI should be able to get that sorted. That being said, I have several of their products and it's been like this for over a year. You can use the gimbal without the app, but you lose the feature to take photos and interact with the phone through the controls. The zoom/focus knob is extremely sensitive when paired with my phone. It's absolutely unusable and I had to disable it. An occasional bump into it would cause it to try to zoom in or out, not even turning it was required to trigger it. It would be nice if you were able to adjust sensitivity in the app or map it to a different feature all together. Personally, the extendable feature feels a little gimmicky. When I brought it on vacation, I rarely extended it and found it unnecessary in most situations. Taking a selfie was the only exception where it was nice to have, but even then, I was able to extend my arm in widescreen mode and fit people in without issue.

Overall, I do like it when compared to my old gimbal. You'll be able to hear my old one in the unboxing video, the motors are much louder when compared to the DJI one. You can't even make them out and that is a big plus. I would say build quality is 5 stars and if you are looking for a great brand name gimbal DJI is hard to beat. If you want to upgrade from last generation I would say don't bother. It sits at 4 stars for me since it really doesn't play as nice with Android, but Apple people will have completely different experience. If I can get my hands on an iPhone I will update my review with that experience.

title: Perfect for any phone
text:
This charger is an amazing portable charger, and it has even more features than they show in the manual or on this listing. It's not perfect, but it's still an extremely competitive option at a reasonable price. The charger takes around 3 hours and 15 minutes to charge when using a USB C or Micro USB and lightning takes about 3 hours and 30 minutes. This is when using a fast charger. When using a standard charger, it can up to 5 hours and 45 minutes.

Pros:
The charger can tell you what voltage and current it's charging a device at or what it's being charged at.
Just press the power button to cycle through voltage, current and remaining capacity.
The ability to fast charge it with every modern cable (USB Type C, Micro USB and Lightning) is amazing
and guarantees you will be able to get a new charging cable easily.
Well-built metal enclosure.
Wide compatibility fast charging.

Cons:
Charging 2 phones at once causes both to drop to 5V standard charging speed.

Overall, this charger preforms really well when you're using it primarily for one device. I recently took it on vacation, and it was great in the plane as well as charging my phone in the rental car. I was able to charge my S10E 2 plus times per full charge. I haven't been able to test SCP charging fully since I don't have a phone that uses it, but I plan to get something that can trigger that protocol successfully and test the 5V 4.5A claim. As for now I can confirm that 5V 3A max is going to be the limit for most people. I will update if I have an issue or can confirm the SCP discharge claim.

title: As good as other brands at half the cost
text:
Update after few more weeks.
I wanted to add that while charging with 100w, the reason the charging time was the same as the 90w is because the cell temperature reached the cutoff and throttled back to 60w for both. I ran the test again with the 100w charger, but this time placed it on an ice pack. This allowed it to fully charge in a little over two and a half hours. This at least shows their over temperature protection works but will be the reason you will notice diminishing returns on charging speed when using 60w chargers and above. I also noticed that when the percentage goes below 20 percent or so the 18W USB-A port no longer steps up past 5V.

Original:
This is my second high power portable charger (100w output), and I can safely say if you don't need all the bells and whistles, this is a great choice. The other one I reviewed cost more than twice the amount and this one can do almost everything it could do. It even has a low power feature that is nice. I know longevity is yet to be seen, but I do like the charger so far.

The low power mode allows you to lock the unit on and effectively power devices with low current draw. I can keep an Arduino powered as well as other devices that only take around 20ma at idle. The voltage output is stable and consistent even under load. I like that this charger supports passthrough charging. Like the manual says, if both USB-C ports are in use then they are each capped at 60w. This includes passthrough mode. The manual is good and has all the information you need. I noticed a that it does say a long 2 second press switches the USB-C port from input to output, but I was unable to get that to work. That feature isn't really an issue for me and not something I would use, but if you have that desire then this might not work for your needs. It can charge a MacBook Pro without a problem, and I didn't notice it getting excessively hot while charging it. The carrying bag is nice and the cable provided is good quality that can handle 100W of charging power.

Capacity and Charging:
At 5v 3A I was getting around 84.7Wh, but when I went to 20v 1.5A the capacity was closer to the expected at about 90Wh. I noticed the best efficiency was through the 18W USB-A port. With a 12v 1.5A test reaching 92Wh. This is very close to the rated capacity and when charging, it took in about 115-120Wh. My charging was done with a 90W and 100W charger. This took a little over 3 hours for the 90w and a little under 3 hours for the 100w. This is consistent with my other portable charger of the same size. As a disclaimer, capacity is never going to be exactly what the packaging says and after testing dozens of portable chargers, I have only had a few meet or exceed the rated capacity. To another reviewer's point, this does not get to the 99.16Wh.

Overall:
It's a great portable charger and comparable to other in size for this capacity and power output. It would be great for anything from hobbyists needing a power source for their low power projects or for some that travels and needs to charge a laptop on the go. If I have any issues with it I will update the review but as for now it's great.

title: Pricey but powerful
text:
[[VIDEOID:56882bb10ee32d598de1d18bcc5f2c88]] Let me just start off by saying this is a beast. It has amazing efficiency and awesome capabilities. I know the price of it might scare off most, but if you are looking for a compact power bank that can do it all, then this is an excellent option.

The ability to charge anything from my MacBook Pro to an old S8 makes it the perfect fit for anyone that needs to work in areas they often find themselves without an outlet. The OLED display is easy to read and has the necessary information most would want. The information it's missing is output protocol being used and temps. Those would be nice for a portable charger nerd like myself, but I understand some might not care.

Capacity tests I have run are promising and show a very efficient conversion rate. When running through a few discharge tests at different voltages, I can get 90-95Wh out which is very close to the 99.16Wh the pack holds. So, with energy loss taken into account, this portable charger tests above average.

Charging tests that I have done were with 90w and 100w chargers, but if I see enough interest, I can test charging speeds with a slower charger. That being said, expect around 3 hours to charge the unit. The fastest I was able to charge was at 2 hours and 58 minutes. It takes about 120Wh to charge the pack so there is a little more energy loss on the charging side compared to the discharging side.

Overall, I am very happy with this charger. The price isn't for everyone and this range there are a lot of good competitors. I would like to see a little more configuration available to the user and with the updatable firmware it would be possible. The support teams are very responsive and quick to answer any question you have. Ultimately, there are cheaper options that don't have an OLED screen and if that doesn't interest you then save the money and go with them. For me it's a keeper since the more information the better.

title: Great for most people
text:
TL;DR:
This charger is dense. It is compact yes, but do not think compact means light weight. It weighs a little over half a pound (.66lbs). This is lighter than my other 20,000mAh chargers, but it does deliver slightly less capacity than those. It's cost efficient compared to other and works well with a few limitations. It can charge my S8 over 4 times with power still left. Comes with a USB-A to Type C cable and an oddly included USB-A to micro-USB cable (I would have preferred Type C to Type C). I have included some pictures comparing it in size to my smallest 10,000mAh pack along with a few others.

Performance:
This charger claims 20,000mAh and after testing a lot of portable chargers I know that does not mean you can charger a 4,000mAh battery 4 times. Most brands give capacity at the packs battery voltage and this one is no different. After testing at 12v, 9v and 5v I have an idea of what capacity you can expect.

12v @ 1.5A = 4,923mAh
9v @ 2.0A = 6,505mAh
5v @ 3.0A = 12,178mAh

This was done at max supported current for the given voltage on USB-A port 2. I do not have a huge issue with these numbers since it has a circuit that is ~82% efficient at converting power at 5v. It is not that much worse than my other packs and when you consider the size it is a fair tradeoff. The problem I have is they overrepresent the product in certain categories. First off, the product cannot output 5A at 4.5v like it states in the manual. I do not know if this was a typo or just overconfidence, but after about 3A the voltage sag is tremendous. I have included photos to show this. My other complaint is I was unable to charge at 12v on any of the 5+ chargers I own, and this was using multiple cables. It is more annoying to say it does and then does not than to just say you can only charge at 5v and 9v like a lot of other power banks I have.

Charge times from empty:
PD Charger (USB Type C to Type C)
9v @ 2A = 6hrs
Non-PD Charger (Supplied USB-A to Type C)
5v @ 2.9A = 7hrs 23min
9.2v @ 2A = 5hrs 36min

Quality:
I have never heard of this brand and the packaging looks like a supplier mass produces these and the brand slaps their name on it. That being said, it feels well made. The plastic case is sturdy and made with good quality plastic that should handle a drop or two. The 4-dot led display is nice and will glow green when fast charging or discharging. This is a nice feature if you want to know if you are in a higher voltage fast charge mode or only at 5v. The cables supplied are not the highest quality, but it's not a big deal if you already have a cable you like. I am interested to see how the batter holds up since it looks to be a LiPo in the pictures and I have had issues with those in the past.

Overall:
For the price it's an excellent choice and I would recommend this if you are looking for something around 20,000mAh. I don't know how long it will hold up, but I will keep using it and update this review if I have a failure with the pack.

title: Great Compact Charger
text:
This is a very small but capable charger. It is well build and is the smallest 10,000mAh charger I have tested. I have been using this charger for a month now and I can say it has been very reliable. It doesn't lower its output current as it gets close to being fully drained and is comparable to a wall charger for phones that don't use more than 18w. I really like it ability to charge the power bank using something similar to Samsung AFC. The only downside I have notices is that the PD charge controller is limited to 2.4A instead of the 3A stated on the product and in the manual. I would say most people wouldn't notice this and most device would likely switch to a higher voltage at that point. You can only see it when charging the device with USB Type C cables using a 3A capable charger. The cable provided is nice and usable, but I wish it came with a USB Type C to Type C cable in addition to the Type A to Type C cable provided.

Capacity:
The usable capacity of the charger is about 6,500mAh or a more usable number of 33Wh. I would look more at (Wh) for a fair comparison because many modern devices charge at different voltages which affects the mAh observed. It can charge a standard phone at least 2 times with the potential to do a third time on some phones.

Packaging:
Good and compact although it can be tricky to get the charger out. The packaging was also activating the charger because of how snug of a fit it was.

Overall:
I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good and small portable charger. It would be great for both Android phone users as well as the iPhone crowd.

title: Great charger so far
text:
This charger has some very nice features and does exactly what you would expect from a wireless car charger.

The phone that I was using to test this was a Galaxy S8, which supports 10w wireless charging. I can say this charger was able to get close to that with peaks of 9.4w observed. The automatic feature of the charger is very convenient although it will be interesting to see how it holds up. I have tried this charger with a larger phone (iPhone 8 plus) and the charger has just enough space for it, but it does work. I would be careful when placing the ball mount into the socket and I recommend doing so when the plastic is warm or at least at room temperature to avoid one of the 4 clamps breaking. Trust me, I have had it happen with other mounts.

Mount Options:
The mounts included are nice, but the vent one is a bit bulky. It will not work in my vents, but I haven't found a mount that will work so I'm not really upset about this. The suction cup is nice, but I know from experience with other suction cup mounts they will fail in really hot or really cold temperatures. I have will be using this in another car that the vent mount will work and print a cup holder mount for my main car.

Overall:
I'm happy with this charger and will be using it on my hour plus drive to work. I will update this review if the product fails.

title: Becoming one of my go to chargers
text:
This portable charger isn't perfect, but for most people it would be an excellent choice.

Packaging:
The box is very nicely designed and gives a lot of details about the charger. The box was beat up but the charger was undamaged. The two in one charger is great and my only complaint is it didn't come with a protective sleeve.

Main Unit:
It has a premium feel and is one of my nicer chargers. I have reviewed a lot and own a lot. This has quickly become one of my favorite chargers. The phone I use it with is a Samsung Galaxy S8, but I have tested it with the iPhone 7, 8 and the Essential PH-1. This is where some issues appear. The charger works great on the Samsung and iPhones (using USB-A port), but the PH-1 had issues charging at the 18w rated. I have observed the USC type C port having difficulties with the Power Delivery standard not only when charging other devices, but when being used to charge the pack. I can't get it to charge at 12v like it is supposed to. I have bought a few PD chargers purely to test this as well as some of the best cables that available. This lets it charge itself close to 18w at 9v, but it needed the better cable. I have also noticed if I charge my S8 from the QC port then plug in a device to the USB type C port the charger resets. The screen turns off and the phones momentarily stop charging. The charger resumes charging, but doesn't always return to 9v charging on the S8. This is the biggest and only problem I have found so far.

Capacity:
To start I would like to give the adjusted capacity of the pack. 10000mah after conversion from 3.7v to 5v should give 7400mah total capacity. Using a 2amp 5v draw, I was able to get a around 6700mah average. This is actually good and has a conversion efficiency of ~91%. This is what you should expect when charging an iPhone from the USB-A port, but if you charge a phone that uses QC or PD then you can expect much lower capacity since the voltage can go up to 12v which will lower the effective capacity to ~3000mah before conversion loss. When charging my S8 with QC I get about 4600mah of useful capacity.

Overall:
I would recommend this charger for its build quality and price. Since I have bought this at 22.99 I have seen this charger drop to 12.99 for the grey model and 19.99 for the blue one. At that price it would be hard to find a charger that does as well as this does in the price range. I only gave it 4 stars due to the issues I faced charging with PD, and if you have Pixel you might have a different experience then I did. I look forward to testing more of their chargers and I hope their quality continues into their 20000mah model with hopeful improvement to PD charging. If I have any issues that develop I will update this post and let you all know.

title: Potentially Defective
text:
Update (7/20/18):
The Company contacted me below and was very helpful in resolving my problem. They sent me out a new cable (the upgraded 3.0 usb one) and it works as expected. The cable is thicker and makes a more positive connection. It also charges in both positions and is charging extremely well. This company stand behind their product, and as someone who reviews a decent amount of charging devices, I can safely say that pride in their product shows.

Original:
The charging cable is nice, but has a few issues.

The cable itself feels nice and seems to be constructed well. The issues come when charging my S8. It has a problem with orientation, and by that I mean it only fast charges in one direction. It gives an error message stating improper connection when oriented one way but fast chargers fine when flipped. I get this error on a few of my cheaper cables, but not on any of my quality cables. (Cables ranging from 5 to 40 dollars per) I think this cable may be defective, but as the cable sits, I have to give it only 3 stars.

title: well made but i like the apple certified one better
text:

It will take about an hour longer to fully charge with this cable but if its something you use next to your bed before you go to sleep you won't notice. It is a little bit more manageable than the thicker cable and makes it less bulky but that is the trade off for charge speed. It is personal preference which one you'll like better but they are both good products.

Update:12/9/2014
The product has failed in under a year, which in all honestly isn't a surprise. This isn't built as well as the Certified one, but I will contact IXCC and see what they can do.

Update:12/14/2014
They stood behind their product and shipped another out which I am very grateful for. Overall a great company to deal with and I am very happy with their customer service.

text: I felts that this was a great concept. However, in practice this phone holder does not work as well as I thought it would. Mounting is fine although the adhesive is strong enough to make removing it a pain. However positioning the ball takes some forethought and cannot be used on all cars. Ideally, the mounts should be placed on a vertical surface on the dashboard. This should allow for the greatest amounts of viewing angle possible. On top of a dashboard surface does not allow the phone to rotate to a comfortable viewing angle. This was unfortunate because my car does not have a good vertical surface for the amounts to be placed on. Also, having a magnet on the back of my phone was not s an ideal situation. It makes it a hassle to put in and out of a pocketand also I fear that  I will accidentally put the phone near my wallet which will erase my credit cards. As a results I decided to go with a different mounts that simply has a metal plate to go on the phone case and a magnet that is only on the mounting arm. title: Sleeker for pocket carry
text: I've had a Defender for quite awhile and decided to change cases because the silicone outer layer stretched out. The Commuter has a hard outer layer which may hold the shape of the silicone inner layer better. I find that this case seems to work pretty well. I dropped my phone with it on almost immediately on a tile floor with no apparent damage. The screen is brighter without the built-in shield on the defender, and the Commuter package comes with a self-adhering screen protector separately. The outer plastic shell is pretty slick, but I've had no issues with losing my grip. It allows for easier transition into and out of my pocket than the Defender. My one gripe is that the buttons are stiff enough to pose a hassle when working the power button and volume controls. So far, I'm pretty happy with this product.

title: Reliable performer
text: I have had this speaker in the car for quite a while now and use it regularly. It is small and light allowing it to be mounted on the sun visor without affecting the visor's ability to stay in the up position. Sound quality is adequate for conversations and the volume can be set quite high. Music playback quality is atrocious and I'm not sure why Jabra even included this feature on this product. The microphone works well and picks up speech a normal conversational volume whether the visor is up or down. There is no need to strain or shout to be heard. The batteries last an incredibly long time and I have gone for about 2 months between charges regardless of temperature levels. Pairing the phone is very easy and reliable. The unit shuts off after awhile if not paired to a device; however, will turn back on and pair to the phone automatically when entering the car. A motion sensor lets the unit know when you enter the car and to shut down a few minutes the Bluetooth connection is severed. One thing that is really annoying is the range of the Bluetooth antenna on this thing. My phone stays connected for over half a block after I exit the car. If I park too close to the house and get a call I am yelling hello without realizing that the speaker in the car has maintained the connection to my phone. I don't think Jabra needs to have such a long range antenna for a unit that will be used within the confines of a car. Overall, I have been happy with this product.

This purple wallet style phone cover is absolutely the best I have ever had for a phone. My last three covers were not nearly as nice and this one has several upgrades.

3 slots inside for cards - these card slots would tightly hold a bus or train card, a debit card or a healthcare card, 'm not going to use them because I only trust my zippered small wallet, but I am pretty sure they would be safe in there.

Zippered pocket - It is a real pocket! I am using it to hold and emergency stash of cash but it is big enough for some cards and the zipper is real and works, which means your cards and cash will not fall out.

a grommet at the top of the wallet cover - I always wanted something like this on my old phone cover so that I could leave the house with my house key when I went for a walk or for a quick coffee down the hill.

Purple - this is a true purple, like royal purple of Marvel villains purple and I love it. I like a lot of different colors of purple but this is my favorite and it is purple suede (or something that looks and feels like suede) which makes me double happy.

magnet clasp - the magnet clasp really does work and there is a satisfying clicking sound when it is clasped.

Protects my phone from clumsiness - So I gladly would have used my old phone for a few more years but I dropped it face first on my tile floor and of course the screen cracked. So I had to get a new phone and this new cover and I have already dropped this phone, face first on the same tile that broke my other phone. However this time the case, even being opened stopped my new phone from breaking.

All in all this cover is great, so nice in fact that i am going to order another one because I hope to have this phone for a few years.

title: Bright colors make these a cinch to find on a busy day
text:
I love this stylus. I dont know when they started coming in different colors but it is seriously a great upgrade for someone like me who keeps losing things.

So it works with my phone, which is a sorta old android and it works with my husbands phone which is newer.

It is very lightweight and so doesn't add to the weight of my small cellphone/wallet bag (the weight is a concern for me because I have some shoulder issues) and it is so small and slim that it doesn't take up precious space.

It seems fairly sturdy since I have dropped them on the tile floor a few times and it is cat proof, my cat chewed up the ends on my old stylus (she is crazy).

title: Disappointing, fell off after a couple of days
text:
My husband and I both tried these and had the same experience, his fell off the first day, mine on day three.

While they were attached, they were convenient and had a slim profile that didn't interfere with my use of a phone stand.

Just a little information about how we used these, cleaned the back of our phones with alcohol wipes, made sure to fully dry the phones and then applied the phone grips, it didn't matter, they still fell off.

Anyways, these grips just don't work.

title: Great phone for under $300
text:
I am not a phone gamer or anything, but I have a bunch of apps that I need:
authenticators, Outlook, Gmail, the app I use to pay my rent and put in repair tickets with my landlord company, a banking app, the app I use to track my weight on my bluetooth scale, chat apps for work and family, etc, and this one is speedy for all of them.
It's not too heavy, it's not too large or small, (see attached picture for scale).
The UI is really close to my previous Samsung Android experience.
The last phone I had (Samsung Galaxy A6 Plus (SM-A605G/DS) 4GB / 32GB)
had finally started to slow down and have trouble since it only had 32 GB internal storage.
But I have a good feeling about this one, I think this one should last a few years for me.
I am very happy I could get a replacement for under 200 dollars.

title: Makes my workplace more efficient
text:
How many times have I needed my phone to be handsfree, but not propped up on my desk while I am working on something on my main computer?

The answer is every time!

This desktop stand is perfection.

Easy to put together.
Doesn't take up precious room on my crowded desk
Is just elevated enough that when I'm on video with it my coworkers eye level is above the clutter and detritus of my workspace.
lightweight - I knocked it over a couple of times when I was working out where it was most useful.

I feel like my desk got a nice, useful assistive device and that it is long overdue. Our workspaces have been changing as we add new technology and so we have to keep them updated too.

This dock is great and I wish I'd gotten it when I started to use my cellphone for more than just phone calls at work.

title: For serious Potter fans only!
text:
This Marauder's Map case would only be perfection if the wallet opened the same way as the map in the film, like french doors, but other than that it is amazing.

The slight bit of weathering, all the place names inside of the castle and the beautiful picture of Hogwarts are so cool, it makes me happy every single time I see it. Just like in the movies and books, the map is a secret and so is often kept packed away from anyone and everyones hot little eyes. But whenever people see it, they say something about it. It is always something along the lines of, "Oooh, where'd you get that?"

So far, it has been surprisingly sturdy, very little creasing on the spine of the case and since it has been opened and in almost continous use for a couple of months now, I think it is very well made.

Inside has the standard gel mold to hold your phone in place and since the strap is magnetic once you have the case in place the phone is ready to use and it looks like a real magical artifact, like something the Weasly Twins would be giggling over.

This would make a great gift for a Potter fan.

Sincerely reviewed by; Mademoisselle Ashwing Mischief Managed!

title: Lasted less than two months- very disappointing
text:
I have a tisuns wallet flip cover for my phone, the exact same cover except that mine is pink. So when my husband got a new phone he got the same cover, but his was green instead of pink.

The inside of the cover has a slim pocket and a suede'ish liner, the liner began to seperate within a month. I have had mine for a while now, at least three months, and aside from being a little scratched up on the outside from carrying it with my keys it is holding up perfectly.

I'm not sure what to say, but I guess experiences with these covers vary, a lot. Buyer beware or if you change out the covers frequently, this one could last several months to about a month.

I really like this case. My phone is very snug inside of it and I like that I can carry around some cards and money. About the only way to make this perfect would be if it had a strap to carry this. I'd like to leave the house with just this case. But I don't trust myself with holding onto it without at least a wrist strap.

The color is bright and a little more green than in the picture. I like it. It makes it super easy to find in my bedroom or my purse. The opernings on the back of the case are the perfect size for the camera. You wouldn't believe how much struggling I had with my last phone case.

The strap keeps the case closed, not that it would matter, since the phone it shows no sign of falling out.

But best of all is that I like the way it feels when I hold it. The leather (or whatever its made of is smooth and not the least bit sticky) and there are enough spots for me to keep my drivers license, insurance cards and a credit card close at hand.

The flex should made it very durable.

Instead, the pattern is on the inside, and the outside is smooth. I realize many people prefer a smooth outside, for ease of slipping it in or out of the pocket.

text:
Fits perfectly. Feels good. Attractive color. Smooth back so it does slide on our granite countertops, but only if pushed. Has better grip than smooth plastic. We do not use screen protectors. We put that expense toward a protection plan. Sometimes Applecare, sometimes Square Trade.

I'm glad OtterBox discontinued screen protectors on these.

title: Make sure your phone is one touch.  See my sob story.
text:
Good case but doesn't work for me. I have an Idol 5s phone. Not one touch. Did not realize there was a difference.

Mine has the fingerprint sensor in back which makes this case unusable because it covers up the fingerprint area. Good case. Stupid phone maker that puts the fingerprint sensor in the back of the phone. May try to cut a small hole in the back of the case.

title: Very good quality phone.  Would highly recommend this phone, if a quality case became available.
text:
This review is for the ad free version.
This is a review of a Vine Product I received at no cost, but fully taxable as income based on the msrp. So not free by any means.

A very good phone with a few negatives. Closer to a four than a three. I currently have been using IPhones for 5 years. My current one is a 6s. With many new android phones showing promise, and the ever increasing cost of IPhones, I wanted to update my Android skills. This Vine item presented that opportunity.

Easy to transfer many items from my IPhone to this phone, using the cloud setting. Smoother than I thought.
Android system has improved tremendously from the awkward system that caused me to go to the IPhone.

Review of the hardware.

Well made phone that looks more expensive than it is. Looks as good as the Iphones.
Clear display. Very good color, good layout.
I rate the speakers on a par with the much more expensive IPhones. I listen to music frequently, via , Iheart, Amazon Vine music.
Quality sound is important to me. I rate the sound quality of music through the speakers as excellent.

Cons.

No case available? I should say, there are no reviews of the few cases available. I tried using generic cases, but they blocked part of the speakers, which are front facing, top and bottom. With a case, a solid 4. Without, a shaky 3.5. I did post a question to the Amazon community asking if anyone had found a good case. There were no responses. I realize many users don't care about a case. I do.

A number of reviews have compared this model to the previous Idols. I have not had previous models and can't make the comparison.

The fingerprint sensor is placed on the rear of phone, which I find awkward. The IPhone has it on the front. That makes more sense to me. I can see if the sensor is reading my print. Can't do that when it's on the rear.

I took identical photos using my wife's IPhone 7 plus, and the Idol 5s. The Idol photos had a washed out look. That surprised me given the good pixel count, and good color display. The photos were taken on a cloudy day, with no direct sunlight. The IPhone 7 plus did cost $ 769.

If getting good photos, rather than great photos does the trick, you will be happy with this phone. When I said the photos were washed out, they were being compared to photos taken by a much more expensive phone. They are fine for Facebook posting, sharing, and satisfying most needs. If playing music through the phone's speakers is important, you will enjoy this phone.

title: I like the case, but it failed 2 water tests.
text:
I received this item free through the Vine Program. I have a Lifeproof case for my IPad Pro 9.7 and love the lightness of it. My favorite case.

I did the water test twice with this case, and both times tiny water droplets were in the part that should stay dry. For those that don't know, the case comes with a dummy phone which is inserted into the case, and which you submerge in water for 30 minutes. I would be concerned if I used this on a raft in a pool. For my usage, it is not a problem. I don't use it in situations where a waterproof case is a necessity. In addition, the IPhone 7 is reasonably waterproof. Consumer Reports verified this. In summary, I like the case. The removal tool is great. Miserable to remove some cases. This is a snap. I had to give it three stars based on my water test.

title: Tale of 4 watchbands.  Comparing Belkin to the more expensive choices.
text:
Belkin makes good products. The band looks attractive in gray. Somewhat thick. There are a large number of holes so it will fit most wrists.

This is painted leather. Also called protected leather. That is the type found in leather furniture in most homes as it's affordable and stands up well. Paint protects. I would expect it to be warm on a sweaty wrist, as it won't breathe. It is a nice band for the money.

Reason for deducting a star. Recently purchased 2 Apple watches. One had an Apple Modern Buckle, the other a classic buckle. I compared the Belkin to these.

The Modern Buckle sells for $ 249 on the Apple Web Site. It has a magnetic clasp. Unfortunately, it had a limited number of holes, and is sold in 3 wrist sizes, all 38 mm. It came with the watch, and it was too big for my wife's wrist. She gave me the band. I wore it for 5 days, and the leather is very thin, strong, light and soft. Doesn't feel like you're wearing a watch. Because it's not painted leather, water will probably stain it over time. The Belkin feels heavy in comparison. You know you are wearing a watch. Don't think the Modern Buckle is worth $ 249 though.

The other watch came with the classic buckle, and sells in the Apple stores for $ 149. Definitely less stately than the Modern buckle, but a nice enough leather. Felt nice on the skin.

My wife then decided to order the Hermes Single Tour watchband from the Apple website. Beautiful classic look in a good choice of rich colors. She previously wanted to order the Hermes Apple watch. None to try on where we live. We were going to Vegas for a week, so she expected to buy one there. Just came back from a vacation in Vegas. Only the Hermes flagship store at Shops of Crystal carried it, and was sold out. Though $ 339 for the Hermes band sounds expensive, it's no contest between the Hermes and the Apple Modern Buckle. Well worth the extra $ 90 for the Hermes.

Summarizing.

The Belkin gives excellent value for the money. Fit the watch perfectly, buckled well, and I'm not afraid of losing the watch, due to a faulty band. Also a good band to wear if you expect a wet day.

title: Presidio name confused me. Give different models different names.
text:
Speck should not use the name Presidio for different products.

We ordered the Presidio Grip. Really liked the grip effect, but my wife didn't like the drab gray color.
We ordered this one, thinking with the Presidio name, it would still be somewhat grippy. The color is fine, but it slides.
Dropped it lightly on the granite countertop, and it slid across.
Doesn't slide like a toboggan, but it could easily be knock off a countertop or table, if something accidentally hit it. Something like your hand reaching for something else.
If you feel more secure with a grippy phone, get the Speck Presidio grip.
If you are careful, and don't mind the slide, this is a very nice product.
The star deduction deduction is for the slide.

title: Good wallet case.  Only room for one card or license.
text:
I prefer wallet phone cases. Can carry my license when I don't want a wallet.
Will only hold one item, whether a license or credit card. Can be tough to slide card out.
On a plus case, I expected to be able to slide in more than one card. Reduced one star.

Attractive case. I thought my Iphone 6 case in black looked sharper.

title: Usual Speck quality.  Doesn't slide.  Good tight fit. Easy on. Difficult off.
text:
Usual Speck quality. The new dongle for fitting into the lightning connector fit perfectly. No obstruction.

Went on easily. Tough to get off so it's a good tight fit.
Will stay on if dropped.
Good grip. Doesn't slide on our granite counter.

I got the gray which is a good choice for a business cover. Not flashy. Color too plain for my wife's taste.

title: A Speck fan.  May have received a defective one.
text:
May have received a defective one.

I am a Speck fan and have long used their cases. This had a bulge at the top, and it just wouldn't straighten.
Sent it back to Amazon.

Also, I want to add that I also use the Moshi IVisors that I purchased from Amazon. The tightness of the case knocked it off every time. I have always used Ivisors with my Speck cases. Needed another case quickly. Purchased another brand locally, same style, no problem with the IVisor.

title: Nice quality case.  Sold new only by Pad&Quill.
text:
We have a Pad&Quill and A BookBook Iphone 5 cases. The P&Q is about .3 ounces heavier (postal scale), but about the same size. I like the P&Q, my wife prefers the Book Book. Both are nice. Buy BookBook only from a very reliable source, as it is a heavily counterfeited item. The Iphone fits snugly into the wood frame. I think the wood adds class. The case is a single color, and plainer looking than I expected. Not at all like the Book Book. The leather looks rich, and the phone's sound comes through clearly. The strap adds class, but I'm not sure about its longevity. I forget my wallet a lot (retired), but never my phone. I keep my license, and one credit card in the case. Who needs cash? The P&Q is unlikely to be counterfeited due to the wood frame inside.

The Book Book looks more than a designer item, while the P&Q looks like a mini address book.
I got free shipping ordering directly from P&Q. Discount codes/clearance pricing available on a few items.
Kindle touch anyone. They have a really great discount on that one.

Finally- and important. With the new ATT (others) cellphone plans, where there is an excellent discount if you have your own out of contract phone, there is great incentive to protect your phone in a good case. I was getting a new phone every 2 years. Now I hope to keep ours for 4 years. That makes these pricier cases a better value.

title: Excellent item.  Iphone 4s white.
text:
Just bought two Defenders. This was for the 4S white phone. Both excellent. My main comment concerns the watermark. This went went on without the watermark issue. My other defender case has the issue. After removing the case 3 times, and cleaning both the phone and case with a microfiber cloth, I finally accepted the mark. I went to the ATT store, and the salesman told me it is very difficult to avoid the watermark problem. It happens or it doesn't. Doesn't appear when phone is on, so who really cares?

If the knowledge that the watermark is there will bother you, get a Speck with a Moshi Ivisor. No watermark, but not as rugged.
My wife carries her Iphone 5 in her purse, and the Speck Ivisor combo works great for her.

title: Not compatible with iPhone X, not even with their "film"
text:
The listing here and the packaging say that it works with iPhone X but that they prefer you apply their "film," which is a circular clear sticker. They want you to put the clear sticker on the phone and then attach the handle to the sticker. I did this, and it worked fine for about 2 days, and then POP, it just came right off. The handle sticks to the sticker, but the sticker does not stick to the phone.

I'm very lucky I wasn't actually holding up the phone with the handle when it came off. The phone would have shattered. I was just picking it up off my countertop and it didn't fall far.

It does seem like a quality product and I probably would have been very satisfied with it if I had another phone. With the glass back on the iPhone X, it doesn't work.

title: Hard to use, doesn't stay on, ugly, not enough protection to justify those problems
text:
I got this case to protect the watch during certain activities - primarily rock climbing. I wanted a case that could be installed and removed easily and repeatedly because I want to use it just a few times per week. It's a two-piece unit. You have to take off the band, install the back piece, and then press the front piece onto the back piece. There are little rubber tabs that go from the back to the front. The biggest problem with using it for this purpose is that it very quickly became impossible to get the little tabs to line up, and therefore impossible to get it securely installed on the watch. I think I was happy with ease of installation the first time or two, and then after that, it became much harder to use.

In my opinion, if it's going to be that hard to install, it should work really well. It doesn't. It doesn't fit well on the watch (Series 2 aluminum using Apple original "sport band"). It doesn't cover the crown. And after just a few install-remove uses, the tabs don't line up, so it's constantly falling off.

And good heavens is it ugly. It protrudes in every direction and the material quality is really poor... so it makes a great-looking product into a cheap-looking product. It looks like a $10 sport watch.

I am now going to try the Orzly InvisiCase, also bought from Amazon. So far, all I can say for the InvisiCase is that it is much faster to install and it looks much better. A case only works if you use it. I'm going to use the Orzly and I am not going to use the Spigen (because it is frustrating to try to install it and it doesn't stay on).

title: Screen looks great. You can't even tell it's on.

The glue holds strong and no dust is getting in the corners. I often have the phone in my pocket with my keys or coins and so far no scratches.

title: A Bath Ballistic with Bubbles
text:
LUSH's bath ballistics don't normally produce bubbles, which is why this one is a good choice if you are in the mood for a bubble bath but still want the benefit of essential oils.

The "Champagne Supernova" is quite the party as it is filled with confetti. The orange oil makes you feel peaceful and happy while the lime oil is stimulating and refreshing. The only thing different besides the bubbles is that this ballistic takes longer to fizz away into the water.

You may want to add this when you start filling the tub with water so it has a chance to dissolve completely. Since this ballistic doesn't have any cocoa butter in it, you might want to use one of the body butters right after your bath. The one I tried tonight is
[[ASIN:B0002I60FE The Soft Touch Body Butter by LUSH]] which leaves you scented with a spicy vanilla and mango scent.

~The Rebecca Review

But that one worked nicely, though I didn't get a chance to activate it before realizing said phone was indeed the wrong one. So... If you're looking at that phone, I can tell you it worked pretty well. A simple flip phone for what you need and nothing you don't.

title: After minimum use 2 out of 6 already failing
text:
I have bought them to carry with my 6-output charger. I keep two USB-C and two standard USB along with the charger in an ample, good quality case. A few months ago the first one stop working (during a trip). Last month the second one went kaput too (on another trip). Awful quality. Avoid this as the plague.
MANUFACTURER/IMPORTER: Do not contact me. I do not care for your silly excuses/apologies/offers. This is a terrible product. Period. It is worrisome that Amazon recommends this product.

text: Great stylus -- they don't drag across the screen but move smoothly, and I love the narrow tip. Perfect for my Kindle as well as my Galaxy phone. The elastic strap makes it easy to secure the stylus to the device.

title: Works With OnePlus But Not OnePlus
text:
I was under the impression this one was a OnePlus charger, it's not from the company, it is stamped with a different name, guess I should have known. I have my original OnePlus charger I just needed an extra one. OnePlus does sell them on their website, but sometimes ordering from Amazon is quicker, you get what you pay for.
The original is a lot heavier, this one is super light in comparison, doesn't stay put as well. The quality is not bad but not OnePlus quality. The cord does not feel as heavy or durable either, but the charge so far seems to be okay as far as time, how long this will last who knows.

title: Works, But Not Fast
text: It works fine, not issues with it, but if you were charging you phone with a basic charging with basic charging times and thought this would be faster, you will be disappointed. Time to charge different devices were not impressive. I would say if you just need something to replace a faulty one you have, sure. Putting 25W sounds like it's faster, it's not...try a 65W with another brand.

title: Works Great and No Call Problems
text: I have been using this daily for phone conversations and have had no problems hearing on the call. It's really comfortable even on long calls and the headband is very adjustable too. It has adjustable volume on the headset or use your phone's volume. The caller has no problem hearing me, and the sound is very clear when someone is talking. Haven't had breakup problems unless I walk quite a good distance from my phone, into back side of house for instance. The mic sits well, easy to adjust and it also has a mute button on the mic itself which is nice. Uses a micro USB connection, and I normally just plug in when I'm done with a call. Can't really say for sure how long I get on a full charge, but have used the headset for about three hours straight and had no change in the quality of the calls. Great little headset.

title: Made Good Not Hard Plastic
text: I purchased this for my OnePlus 8T, fits great. The button placement, camera, all good. I like the black, makes it look clean, and I can actually see the color of my phone unlike others. It does seem to have a little bumper area on the corner and camera and seems like it would be okay with a short drop. I have put a protective gorilla glass on the front, but don't see much protection for the face with this case. The case seems good, not hard plastic or cheap feeling.

title: Very Thin Hard Plastic
text: I ordered the red, the photo is the same thing I received. It fits my OnePlus 8T with no problems. It is very thin, but it is also hard plastic, it's fine for decorative purposes, but not good at all if you ever dropped your phone there is no way it will protect your phone. I did get what was described ( a basic hard plastic back cover) so I can't complain, I do think for what you receive it is way over priced. I would say at most $3.

title: Fingerprints Galore
text:
I wanted to like this, but the concept is better than reality. Mirrored looking finish on the front is a constant battle with fingerprints. Also, you can see slightly through it, but not by much and certainly can't access anything with the cover closed. The case is very thin and not durable.
I think a barely frosted cover would have been better, make it a soft silicone/plastic cover and durable like a wallet cover. They need to forget this idea, it's not good if you need to touch your phone.

title: Fits Great
text: No problems, fits great and you can talk on the phone with the cover closed. Protects the phone, but also flips back and you can use it in landscape mode too. Sewing looks good, all cut outs are good, worth it.

title: This Is The Third Case I Purchased
text: Why? Because it fits the OnePlus 8T very well. All the cutouts are good. Looks clean with the stitching. All the cases I purchased for my phone from this store, Feitenn, has been good for the OnePlus 8T. This is 'leather' looking, not genuine. However, the material looks okay and no chemical smell.

title: Fits the OnePlus 8T
text:
With the phone being so new there are not many covers for sale yet, and here there was no reviews so I wasn't sure, but so glad I got this case. It's fits really well, all the buttons and cutouts are right. It folds back and can help set up the phone in landscape. The cover protects the phone when I put it in my purse or coat pocket. I can also close the cover while talking. It's clean looking and not bulky. No complaints, I ordered another color.
Update- Oct 31, 2020, I just purchased two more phone covers, the one in the blue and one in black (faux leather). Both are good, fits no problem, stitching good, no chemical smell and the blue looks even better in person.

title: Small and Simple Design
text: I purchased two of these one in silver and rose. They both feel pretty solid and good for a small corner on the desk. It holds my phone, even in my flip case. It has the space for the cord but I found it just was a little too lightweight pulling the charger in and out. If you flip the phone in landscape with the bottom charger plugged in on the left or right side if felt more stable. I think overall it doesn't take up too much room, but needs more weight on the bottom to make it sturdier. If it even had a way to mount it on the wall, that would make it easier with charging and sturdiness. The price is good for what it is.

The clasp did not hold up. Unfortunately for me, the 12 month warranty just expired a couple months ago. I'm hoping the company will reach out to me and offer me a replacement.

title: You get what you pay for, steer clear.
text:
What I look for first and foremost in a case is apparent durability... I know, this is a $10 case, so I can't expect an otterbox level of protection, even if that's what I was secretly hoping for. The case arrived today, and I finally just opened it up, and placed my at&t note 3 inside.

The first thing I noticed in dismantling the case to place the phone inside, was just how cheap the rubber outter layer felt. I feel very certain that if I am not careful, it will easily tear, rendering the rest of the case useless. The second thing I noticed was how flimsy the entire inner shell feels, I mean, again, for $10 what can you really expect? I'll be putting this case through the paces for the next week or two, but I almost guarantee that after even one drop, it's going to be done, and you'll need another case. My advice? Spend the extra $20 if you can swing it, and just get the otterbox defender instead. I have had nothing but positive experiences with otterbox products. I chose this case because money is tight at the moment, but after feeling how flimsy the case, and it's built in screen protector are, I almost feel as though I would have been better off carrying the phone nude in my pocket instead. All this case does, and this is the only upside in my opinion, is adds a pleasant amount of "chunk" to the phone, making it feel more like an old original gameboy in size, and making it slightly more comfortable to hold.

Tl;dr:

I have regrets.

title: 6.8/10 I expected more for the price but mostly it was pet peeves and deterioration
text:
I bought this phone from Amazon in February 2020 for $500, and so far I would say it fell short of my expectations of what a $500 phone from a major brand like LG should be.

Battery life: when the phone was brand new the battery life would get me through a 12 hour day with plenty of phone use with some battery to spare. It wasn't phenomenal but definitely was not insufficient, it was within expectations. Unfortunately I did notice a rapid decline in battery longevity and only months later the battery was only good for 6-10 hours without a charge. And I don't mean constant use I mean using it on and off throughout a regular day.

Fingerprint sensor is nearly worthless because any amount of dust, oil, condensation will require 7 attempts before success, unfortunately the phone locks you out after 5. . .

Face recognition worked very well but what is the point when it requires mandatory fingerprint or pattern unlock nearly half the time, why have the face option in the first place?

One of the springs for the MP3 port got stuck within a month, and not from abuse. Now it won't hold an mp3 plug enough for headphones or speakers to work.

After a year the charging port does not hold much pressure, but this degrade was at least slow amd consistent and within normal expectations.

Complaints: The constant requirement of fingerprint instead of allowing face recognition, and requiring pattern unlock instead of accepting fingerprint recognition . . . why even bother with the convenient unlock options if the phone doesn't unlock the phone without requiring a less convenient one half the time! I got into a serious accident on a ski slope and had to get someone's attention from the side of a ditch to get them to call ski patrol because I couldn't get into my phone because it wouldn't take face unlock and my mobility was no longer good enough for pattern. . .

The keyboard learns nonsense words like "tge" and saves them, and gives no option whatsoever to delete them from the phone's memory, the phone no longer corrects any common mispelling and I have no way to fix this other than installing obnoxious second-hand keyboard apps.

Front camera has no zoom and doesn't focus on what I want, then takes pictures when I don't want to because I click the screen two times too quickly trying to adjust the focus of the camera. Camera quality is acceptable, not great and not embarrassing.

One big complaint is that I always have screen rotation turned off but the phone allows itself to rotate in certain apps despite this. I'm sure this has to do with the app and not this phone but it really ticks me off.

Microphone on speaker isn't great, people often have to ask me to repeat something or speak up, even though I don't use a phone case and am speaking into the phone.

I guess overall this phone has deteriorated faster than I wanted it to in terms of battery life and ports, and some of the system features that come in the phone really sap my energy like the security features (I have turned off screenlock because of this) and the keyboard memory.

What I do like about it is that it never ever ever lags from hardware, only from internet connection. Screen is great, music is touted to be good but I'm a regular listener I can't tell any difference, speed is great, and the phone mostly meets my expectations, would have been great with better software.

Overall 6.8/10

If the mp3 port didn't fail in a month (I don't abuse ports) and the battery didn't go downhill so fast I would call this a great value. Warranty claims are very difficult to perform and they will charge you fees if they think the phone is too damaged upon arrival, but don't specify what constitutes damage (scratches vs cracks.)

The screen is awesome, but the screen protector I bought with the phone wasn't cutting it.

Then I got my YouMaker case! The case makes the phone fit very comfortably in my hand, and the built in screen protector is great! The kickstand feature, in both portrait and landscape viewing angles, make using the phone on my desk a joy. I will admit that separating the case the first few times is tough, but if you search on YouTube for a how to video, it will become clear. I actually used a guitar pick to help separate the case cover so that you can open the case and install your phone. It also does not interfere with my wireless charging station, which I had heard was an issue for some cases. Not this one. it works great. Best cell phone case I have ever owned!

The case is lined in a soft pink felt-like fabric, which is an improvement to the more expensive Kate Spade case I had purchased at the cellular dealer. The shipping (with Amazon) was quick. Inside the packaging was a coupon code for 20% off another purchase using the AKNA website. I look forward to purchasing more of these in the future.

Update: 8/12/16 PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU PURCHASE THROUGH AKNA on Amazon (or their own website). I just purchased a second case because I love the first so much but it is a knockoff. The original case is super high quality. This one is not. Photos of knockoff to be included. Please compare all the other user photos. The case purchased from another seller was horrible quality and took almost a month to get here with no tracking information. Do your research and read reviews. This is not the real quality of these amazing cases.

On a lighter note, just ordered another case two days ago and it's here and real. :). Love this company.

text: This is cute, mostly for looks. It fits my phone ok, but I don't think the plastic will offer much protection. It is clearly marked design series, so it is for pretty, and the rose design is indeed, pretty. Will not replace my Otterbox, though.

title: Otterbox Quality
text: The blue color of this case is a nice medium dark blue. There is an inside rubbery piece, and an outside harder plastic shell. There is no screen protector included, but the bumpers do wrap around to the front to give protection to the screen. It is not overly bulky, there is enough texture to the case to hold onto. Seems to be of consistent Otterbox quality.

title: Simple but Effective
text: The case that I got to review is a solid black one. It is a one piece cover for the back of the phone. There is no screen cover. The inside is textured, and the outside is a matte black, with the bumpers slightly rubberized. I have used Otterbox cases for years, and trust their quality. This one seems to be a simple but effective case.

title: Nice Value Phone
text: Nice, reasonably priced phone.  Has a nice feel to it, solid, this one with a stainless look metal back. Comes with several accessories, including a case and screen savers. About the size of a Galaxy android  phone. Has a nice display on the screen, seems easy to set up. A little heavy, probably due to the increased battery size.  Again, nice phone and a good value.

title: Quality build, could be improved for usability
text: My first impression of this mount was that it was well packaged and well presented. My actual use of the product gave me some reservations of how it will be to use it day to day. In order to put my phone into the grips I have to use both hands, one to pry the grips apart and the other to put the phone in. I've used cheaper versions in the past that would let you lock open the grips and would lock into place with a button that would be pressed by the back of the phone when inserted. The other drawback was the wobbling when driving. Maybe it's a common phenomenon of these types of mounts, but it's quite noticeable with the Belkin dash mount. I appreciated the inclusion of the mount pad as well as the option to use my windshield, but either option led to the same amount of screen wobble. The mount feels like a premium product, and is easy to install, but there is room for improvement from its current design.

title: Everything adds Bulk
text: I want to like this case as it has what I am looking for in a phone case. It has complete protection for the screen and the phone itself without the need for a separate screen protector. The case has 3 components to it, the hard plastic inner shell which prevents any immediate damage to the phone itself. After the hard plastic casing is in place, the softer rubber part of the case fits over that and snaps into place better than some less expensive cases I've tried. The feel of the softer case is great, you will not feel like you will drop the case once this is installed. If you have small hands, and can hold the S5 by itself, with this case you may not. This case adds a lot of width to the S5, which was already a big phone and almost makes this as big as the Galaxy Note with this case on. I can still easily access the fingerprint scanner, camera, speaker and USB plug. The buttons remain responsive and easy to click on both sides. I use the headphone jack quite frequently, so I would have to assume that continually removing the flap to access the headphone jack might cause it to wear down over time. The front portion of the case has a significant border that keeps the phones screen from being anywhere near the surface underneath it, but again, this bulk is noticeable. I prefer to use a phone case that has a belt clip available and the belt clip that comes with this case is very sturdy. The phone clicks solidly into place and is unlikely to accidentally fall out while on a belt. Overall this case does have everything I'm looking for: protection, added grip, and a belt holster. The added bulk however is a concern for me that even with larger hands it does change the size of the phone in a noticeable manner.

title: So Far So Good
text: Having tried several cases for this phone, I had been using a lighter weight cover which was pretty good.  This one has a little more grip to it, and seems to offer a bit more protection.  The buttons are a little harder to push on this one, and I am not so fond of the silver logo on the back.  Will not try the dropping features, etc, just to test it out, thanks. There is no screen cover, and none of the cases I have tried so far has had any. Our old phone lived in an Otterbox, and there was always air bubbles under the screen cover, so perhaps this is why so few have this feature anymore.  Never really knew what the old phone looked like, whenever it would get removed from the case, it would seem like Darth Vader without his mask.  These new phones are so nice looking, and want to have the color, so we like this case pretty well so far.  All in all, this is an overall good case.

title: Would Do In A Pinch
text: Simple, basic case with non-slippery surface. A bit  fiddily to put the phone in, had to stretch the somewhat spongy inside cover, and then fit the outside one over.  I didn't like that the color of the phone was covered.  It is an ok inexpensive alternative, and  probably would do.

title: So Far So Good

Not sure that is what we wanted this time. Nothing was available locally, so trying alternatives online. So far, like this simple case very well.

title: My 14th (real) candyshell
text:
I would have broken so many phones without these cases. According to Amazon, this is my 14th candyshell. I've been using them for 10 years, meaning they last an average of about 8 months for me. The plastic at the bottom with holes for the speaker, etc. always cracks eventually. I'm ridiculously hard on phones (clumsy), and the phone almost always survives. These are really, really protective cases, and not as clumsy and huge as an otterbox or lifeproof case.

A few things I've learned:

1. You can go to realspeck.com to make sure it's not counterfeit. This one (from seller GoodPoints Electronics) is real.
2. This is not a good case if you change them out a lot. It fits very snugly, and really wants to stay on.
3. For a few colors/batches, the rubber ring around the face is soft and rubs away, leaving little shavings everywhere and greasy scum on the screen. I've seen it maybe twice times in 10 years. It's not new, but it's not common.

Overall, if you're the kind of person who's likely to drop your phone down an elevator shaft (like me) or out of a moving car (also me), you can't beat a solid candyshell.

title: LOVE IT, LOW BATTERY LIFE
text: I upgraded from a smart phone and wanted a phone to view web pgs in html format(which my code wouldn't do), and i also wanted navigation.  Of course you buy a phone to use as a phone and this one I think is great. Great clarity in the call, so far no dropped calls.  This phone has exceeded all my expectations and has so much more. Purchased it at a corporate metro store and phone was up and running when I walked out. Easy to read and for the most part easy to transition to.  I don't consider myself a tech person and I was able to get the basics down in one day. Used the navigation to go somewhere touristy for fun and it did excellent. Oh and love the voice to text feature!  surprisingly accurate, but please proof read before sending. Ha ha its not perfect. The only reason I don't give this phone a 5 star rating is battery life is a must for a phone, and this little beast is more than just a phone. It's a power packed mini computer which uses its energy. I ran low on on battery life because I forgot to recharge the night before, and it only made it through half the day the next day. I blame myself for the mishap; but I was also using it for several functions too.  I am able get about 3-4 hrs battery life using all the functions: camera, web surfing, email, facebook, app.games, phone, txt, etc... and 5-6 hrs if i used it for primarily texting and phone use only. camera takes beautiful pics and gorilla glass is awesome. web pages load awesomely fast with a dual processor and the option to switch to wi-fi is nice too.  I'm really happy with this phone as long as i can keep it charged. solutions for the battery issues: either purchase an extra battery to have on hand or make sure you have a charger for car and home!  Fyi, my connect is not a prepaid, it is a standard lg connect. so the phone bills either way.
