title: I love it!
text:
I have zero complaints about this! The ring light is absolutely beautiful, and so is the tripod! For such an awesome price, I didn't know what to expect. But as always, Ubeesize didn't disappoint!

The light itself doesn't have any flaws. By that, I mean that all 3 colors work on all levels without any flashing, lagging or any other issues. It's very lightweight and doesn't take up too much space.

The tripod is wonderful! I'm used to carrying around a very heavy Manfrotto, so I'm 100% satisfied with the weight and size of it. It even comes with a bag to carry it in! The quality is up to par. It's very steady at all heights, and is extremely easy to raise/lower.

Setup is a breeze, as the instructions are very clear.

My phone fits perfectly. A larger phone clip is included in case your phone doesn't fit in the standard one, and I think that's a very nice feature.

I'm so thankful for the remote! It works with the camera app on my phone just fine. I even figured out that I can use it with apps like SC by using the iPhone button (I have an Android phone). That's a HUGE plus for me!

I also use this with my DSLR and I capture great pictures. I'll update this review when I've taken more photos.

title: Meets all of my needs!
text:
I love this tripod! It's lightweight but sturdy. I have another UBeesize tripod that comes with their 8in ring light, but due to the features of this one, I put my 8in ring light on it instead of the one it came with. Don't get me wrong, I love both of them, but the easy panning works much better for me.

It comes with a carrying case that you can easily toss over your shoulder, which is another thing that I appreciate because I have so much to carry around. Again, due to its light weight, I don't have to struggle to carry it. It also comes with a remote and an extender for larger phones. The remote works perfectly with my Android (I've been able to use it on the phone camera and apps such as SC by using the iPhone button - just a tip! :)) The level bubble is accurate, and hasn't given me any issues.

I'm used to using my Manfrotto tripod, which is quite heavy, so I can definitely appreciate this because it has some of the same features and isn't a hassle to carry around with my camera and other things.

I have zero complaints about this product, and I look forward to using it for years to come!

title: Perfect!
text:
As a novice photographer, I wanted a ring light and I didn't want to spend a lot of money on it since I'm fairly new to this. Luckily, I came across this company. I got both a great price and a quality product. The light has 3 different tones, all of which have 10 (I think) levels of brightness. All of the tones and brightness levels are beautiful, crisp and greatly improve photos and videos.

The tripod is sturdy and lightweight. I needed a lightweight tripod for the light because my camera tripod and other camera accessories weigh me down enough. The tripod has a built-in level, and I think that is a nice added feature. I had no idea that it was on the tripod until I took it out of the box, so it was a pleasant surprise.

The phone clip is very study and holds my phone perfectly. There is another phone clip included just in case your phone doesn't fit in the standard one, and I appreciate the fact that it is included because it's one less thing one has to buy if needed.

The cord is a good length. The controls on the cord allow you to turn the light on/off and change the tone/intensity (brightness). I have to say that I do wish that the +/- buttons were next to one another instead of the button to switch the tone being in the middle of them. I'll get used to it, though!

It comes with a nice carrying case for both the ring light and the tripod.

title: Sturdy, great quality light and stand

My favorite part is the sturdiness and ability to move each arm so many different ways. It makes this so easy to use and versatile. title: My new walking companion
text:
When I first began walking regularly I thought that since I was outdoors strolling away from my house that I needed stuff. Not a whole bunch of stuff that I pack into my purse, but little stuff: phone; ID; tissues; water bottle; back-up water bottle; money; bandages in case I started to get a blister; stuff like that.

I soon learned that all I needed was my phone and some water. A water bottle with a carabiner clip and my phone in my hand. It worked, but after dropping my phone a few times I started to look for something in which to put it. Tried cross-body bags, a fanny pack and some other stuff, none of it satisfactory.

Then, I saw this phone belt clip holster and ordered it post haste. It works a charm. Keeps my phone safe and I just clip it to my belt. So easy, so nice.

I have a big Moto phone and it fits beautifully, so it will fit any phone. Any. Great product, extraordinarily well made and I will never have to replace it because this ykooe phone holster is going to last forever. Cool.

title: Knew I needed this, but never found one I liked before
text:
Wow. This is a huge improvement to the carabiner clip and elastic hair tie that I have been using. For one thing, part of the screen is no longer obscured by the hair elastic.

This crafty phone holder sits perfectly in one of my cup holder spots. It is close enough to me that I can hear traveling directions as well as the blip my phone gives when someone is trying to call me and then listening to the message that informs them I am busy and will call them back.

I think most people will appreciate how versatile and adjustable it is. The snaky part of the holder can be adjusted to any angle and has a nice extension aspect. It can fit into any cup holder. The side clips hold my phone securely (something the carabiner hair elastic sometimes did not) and it can instantly be adjusted from portrait to landscape viewing.

You really cannot beat the price for the high quality of this car phone holder. Even the car parts stores near me did not have anything of this quality and usefulness for any price.

Glad I ordered it and I think it would be the perfect gift for any driver.

title: Comfortable to wear
text:
Updated 01-04-2021:
Well, once I actually began to attach the lanyard I was able to understand how it works. Out went the hook and loop tape idea; too bulky, not reliable enough.

The adhesive attachment is placed inside your phone case, directly to the shiny back of your phone. Sure, it took me a bit of time, as the instructions are four photos with a single line of text in several languages for each step. So, now the lanyard sticky patch is inside my phone, with the loop poking out of my case, adjacent to the slot used to charge the phone. Discrete, strong and quite amazing. Trips to fetch the mail or downstairs no longer involve needing some big pocket in which to carry my phone.

This is a genius phone holder/carry-er.

Until I saw this, I had tried to make things to hold my phone from my body, but with no real success. This works exactly as described.

The adhesive strip holds.
The lanyard part is nice and thick, so the weight of your phone (mine seems to weight tons) will not stress your neck.
The lanyard can be adjusted to any comfortable length for you.
Kind of looks nice, too.

The only issue I had was that I did not want my phone attached to the lanyard all the time, nor did I feel like detaching the part that sticks to your phone. So, what I did was to use a small length of hook and loop adhesive tape so that I could disconnect my phone from the lanyard with a bit more ease. And, who knows, perhaps that will eventually show some disadvantages as well, and it might be easier to simply use the detachable adhesive part. Time will tell, but I can tell you that this phone-holding lanyard is a game changer when you are moving around doing stuff and do not want to be holding your phone all the time or carrying it in a pouch or something.

Really useful tool for staying connected whilst busy doing things.

title: I'd like a case like this with a window that allows ...
text: I bought this to carry my iPhone 6 plus in an otterbox case usually around the house because when I go out I usually use a slightly larger purse. The phone fits inside the case. With my larger phone in the case, nothing else can fit in the main compartment.  I carry a flash drive in the zippered compartment. I could fit credit cards, my license, and some tissues in there if needed.  It is nicely built and looks nice enough to use to go out. It's more casual than formal.  The strap is a nice length for me to use as a crossbody bag. There is no way to adjust the strap length that I could find unless you tie a knot in the strap.  The clasps on each side do not fit through the loops.  On other bags, the loops were big enough to pull the clasp through and attach it to the other side.  This would double up the strap and make it half the length. I'm happy with this purchase.

I've learned how to utilize the security system and find "Pattern", provides great medium level security. The "Fingerprint", appears to have a few bugs so I'll stick with Pattern as a means of security for now.

Having a Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1, and an existing Gmail address made upgrading via Sprint.com smooth and easy. Taking all the info such as an entire music library, app's, contacts, and folder's from an HTC Evo to the Galaxy S5 and NOT lose a thing was SWEET&EASY¡!♥

title: good quality
text:
UPDATE! I've been using this case for over a year now and it still looks new-ish. Very happy with this one!

This Kindle case is great! It's much better quality than some of the other generic Kindle cases that I've ordered - it feels sturdy without being bulky or heavy. The magnetic closure is strong and it has an auto sleep/wake feature. The blue cover is a lovely turquoise. The plastic shell backing that you snap your Kindle into shows through when you're reading - it's a blue plastic bumper around the edge of the Kindle.
I also love the strap! Nice surprise!
A screen protector is included but that produced glare so I don't use it. There is also a stylus, I don't use it, though, since it's not necessary. Might be a useful bonus for someone, though!

title: Perfection!
text: I LOVE this screen protector. Zerolemon offered me a product to review and I've been using it for a few weeks now, The screen protector is made of glass and fits perfectly over the iPhone 5 screen. It's a smooth, glossy feel. It doesn't feel or look like there is a screen protector on my phone! It is truly oleophobic - no fingerprints, no smudges after making a call, it's perfect! The edges do have a tendency to chip as described in the packaging. Makes sense - it's glass! I have a tiny chip on the edge / side of the screen protector but it's not a big deal - doesn't affect the usage. It was also super easy to install - maybe I just got lucky, but it installed with no problems whatsoever!  I highly, highly recommend this.

title: Love it!
text:
I love this case! I used to have the flex card case and while I loved that case, too, I love this one even more. It feels a lot more smooth/sleek when you're holding it and looks less bulky than the flex case.
I usually keep 3-4 cards in there - my RFID card for work (I can open the doors, etc. while the card is in the case which is awesome), 2 credit cards, and my NYC MetroCard (which is paper thin - a 4th credit card would NOT fit). Like the flex case they all fit well and my MetroCard is snug and secure, I haven't had anything fall out yet! :)
I think this case is a vast improvement over the flex case. Wish that it came in more color options.
I have it on a black iPhone 5 and it looks ok, but would look better on a while iPhone.
There is some scratching on the back as others have noted, but nothing too bad - you only see it if you're looking for it.

UPDATE: Part of the rubber/plastic on the back of the case started to come off after about 5-6 months. I thought that it was just normal wear and tear but decided to contact Speck anyway. They were fantastic - I sent the old case to them and they sent me a brand new replacement case. Highly recommended!

title: protective and a great value
text:
Wow! For the price this case can't be beat. It's a matte plastic shell which covers the back and part of the sides of the iPhone. On the bottom the speaker holes are unobstructed so the sound comes out really clear. Luckily I didn't drop my phone so I don't know how shock-absorbent this case is, but in terms of protection it does a great job.

UPDATE 9/15/13: Well, now I know that this case is shock-absorbent! I dropped my phone down the elevator shaft from the fifth floor. I got my phone back and there was NO MAJOR DAMAGE - it works perfectly and the phone is only slightly dented on the corner. This phone case is BEYOND amazing. You're not gonna find another case of this quality for the price!

text: I bought one of these at Best Buy when they went on clearance a few months back. I wasn't expecting much but was blown away. I decided to get another one as I found it to be such a quality phone for the price. As it is sold out at every other US outlet and site, I decided to buy from Amazon. This particular phone, apparently the 'international version' is exactly the same except that it comes with a set of Sony headphones. The pink color is more rose gold than pink - a really striking finish. I cannot say enough about the quality of this device, particularly its camera. The operating system is lightening fast and the platform is very user friendly (coming from an iPhone). I like the memory card and dual SIM option as well. An additional plus to this device is that it is made in Japan. The downside of this device is the amount of bloatware apps that cannot be deleted but merely disabled. Save for that, you cannot beat this phone for the price.

title: EZ Apply my rear end
text:
I purchased this "original" invisible shield for my brand new iPhone 6. I followed all of the directions. Little did I know that when I first split off the protective layer before applying the gel that it did not split off correctly. I even made sure that the surface I was priming was sticky. I wound up spending 20 minutes struggling to get the layer onto my phone screen per the directions and when I couldn't get it to stick to my phone I finally figured out why - despite feeling like the adhesive side was still attached to the yellow guide, it WASN'T. By then the gel pad was dried out and the "correct" adhesive side had dust specks that cannot be removed without creating even more marks on the protector. I am beyond livid at the poor design of this application method and directions.
As a result I have wasted $15 and it is completely UNUSABLE. Their claim of a lifetime guarantee doesn't cover their poor directions so I'm off to the Apple Store. At least I know their screen protectors WORK. And for the same money I'll have spares. I should never have purchased this waste of plastic. Never again.

title: 2 hours to fully charge a dead iPhone 11
text:
The charger cables come packaged neatly in a box, I'm currently just using one, and keeping the other 2 on standby for when I eventually lose or break this one- as I do with most of my chargers past.
I wouldn't say this is a 'fast charger' for my phone at least. I have an iPhone 11 (yes, an old phone), and I tested the new 'fast charger' out with it when its battery died. It took a full 2 hours to charge from 0% to 100%. It only charged to 34% at 30 minutes with the charger.
I don't mind it not charging quickly, as I'm never in a rush to charge my iPhone. But, I do have another fast charger and it does indeed charge my phone in an hour or less. I'm still using it, since I like the longer cable cord.
Would I get this again? No, it's pretty much the same price as my other fast charger that really is a 'fast charger', so I would buy the other one.

title: First Stress-Free Installation- EVER!
text:
I cannot tell you how happy I am with this screen protector. I always dreaded putting screen protectors on, because of dust getting under, or not being able to line it up correctly, etc. But this otter box screen protector took care of everything. It comes with a microfiber clot and screen wipes- just like any other good screen protector, but the difference with this one is the installation box that it's in. Whoever designed this needs a raise, because this made the installation SO easy! The box adjusts to the size of your phone, and you just drop it in. I cleaned the screen with the wipes and the cloth, removed the protector on the screen protector that is attached to the box, and just lowered it down over the phone, and it snapped into place!
Never have I ever installed a screen protector in one go. I've always had to lift it up once or twice (or even three times more- which at that point I've given up and have decided to live with the dust under the protector), because of dust or because I didn't position it correctly.
The screen is clear, and there are no issues at all with the touch screen with this protector. I love that it blocks blue light.

This protector is absolutely worth its higher price in my opinion. The fact alone that it rids you of the stress of installing is worth it to me. Time will tell how durable the protector is. I tend to have to repurchase screen protectors every 2-3 months from me cracking them because I always drop my phone. But I've always used cheaper protectors, so I have high hopes with this one! Will update.

title: Phone isn't steady, but a good alternative to the vent clip phone holders
text:
I wanted to replace my current cellphone holder that clips onto the air vent because I can't enjoy heat through those vents when I have my phone clipped. I figured this phone holder would be the solution since it's attached to the rearview mirror.
The piece itself seems pretty sturdy, I didn't feel like I needed to be very careful with it when I went to clip it onto the back of my rearview mirror. Set up is very easy, after adjusting the width to fit the mirror, just squeeze the back tabs on each side together, and clip it on. After that, I shorted the front latches so that the holder was secured tightly to my mirror.
My phone clips on easily, and I like that I can pull it down or up and rotate it. What I don't like is that the extension that holds my phone shakes when I'm driving. If my car didn't have bluetooth hookup and I couldn't use my gps on there, I would probably return this because there is no way I would be able to follow my gps on my phone if it was attached to this phone holder, because the screen gets waaay too shaky and unreadable when I'm driving on the highway.
Verdict: For the price, it's alright. Would I go out of my way to purchase this again if this one ever needs to be replaced? No. I only plan to use this holder until the end of the winter, and then I'll be going back to my tried and true ac vent clip magnetic phone holder.

title: Surprisingly comfortable
text:
This came packaged well, and the included hardware made it a breeze to remove the links to fit. The band itself is very lightweight, but it's quite sturdy. The closure feels secure when I use it, and I'm not worried it may unlatch. I bang my wrist a lot while I work, and it has yet to show much wear, and it hasn't broken, nor am I concerned it may break.
I wanted something a little more sleek and mature than the standard silicone bands that come and are offered by apple, and this one fits the bill perfectly.
I've had bulkier versions of this from other brands, that I've always wound up giving away as they weren't comfortable for me.
Very happy with this stainless steel link band, and it's surprisingly great quality for its low price! Would recommend to anyone looking for a more slim link band.

title: Good protection for a low price
text:
The phone case itself is sleek and has just enough grip on the edges without feeling 'gummy' like the branded apple silicone cases do overtime. The inside of the case is the same material as the outside edges of the phone case. The only thing that bugged me about this case was that arrived with scuffs all along the back of it where the harder plastic is installed. If you look carefully, the plastic piece slopes down slightly to where it meets the combo edge material. It's hard to take a photo of it, but I tried my best. For the price, this is not a dealbreaker, but it is something I wanted to mention if this kind of thing bothers some.
The screen protectors are mediocre. They didn't arrive with any installation kits, thankfully I have quite a few from past protectors that give you multiple! You definitely won't be able to install the screen protectors as is, and expect a flawless application. So, with the help of an installation kit I had on hand, I applied the protector to the front screen and camera at back.
So, let's talk about durability. I dropped my phone for the first time while I was kneeling down to pick something up. The phone case protected my phone's body from any visible damages. The screen protector also protected my screen, as it cracked while protecting my screen.
At the end of the day, would I buy this again? Probably not. It bugs me that it doesn't come with an installation kit. If you aren't like me and have a few on hand, you're kind of left on your own to find supplies. The case coming with scratches and scuffs already would also prevent me from wanting to order another in the future. But, for the price it does offer quite a bit. Not the best, but enough to get you by.

title: MUST USE WITH A COMPATIBLE IPHONE CASE, OR NO CASE
text:
[[VIDEOID:49e02b64d0f7dfb9417e86fdb5e2b2a9]] Alright, so I didn't realize that I would need a compatible MagSafe iPhone case to use with this. As soon as I got it, I clipped it onto my air vent with ease and went to attach my phone to it, only for it not to hold at all. I thought that my flexible clear case wouldn't obstruct the magnetic hold, but it did. I wanted to make sure that the magnet on the holder did indeed work, so I pulled off my case and my phone slapped onto it right away. Now, call me crazy but I'm not going to go around with a case-less phone so that I can use this thing- especially if it might fall off while I drive. So, I went and ordered a MagSafe iPhone case and it works perfectly.
Charging power: The fast charging isn't as good as others that I have.
Magnet: Good. You do need to position it straight so that it magnetizes. For example, you can't expect it to attach while you're holding your phone sideways or diagonal to the holder. It has fallen ONCE, on a very bumpy road I was driving down. I wasn't driving fast (40 mph), so as mentioned in the earlier part of my post- I'm happy I got a case.
Sturdiness: Seems okay, I don't feel like I need to be very gentle with it.

title: Sturdy phone stand
text:
This stand is nice and compact, and it folds up which makes it great for taking with me to work.
It's lightweight, but very sturdy. I don't feel like I need to handle it delicately. It adjusts smoothly (love the adjustable height), and holds my iPhone 11 easily. I have the larger iPads, so I don't feel comfortable putting that on there, not because I think the stand will fall over- the base of the stand is weighted and very stable, but because it's a very narrow stand, and I'm too clumsy of a person to have it on there without knocking my iPad off.

title: Easy installation, but only ONE cleaning pack.
text: Installation was easy, and the protective screen is responsive.  I only wish that it came with 2 cleaning kits instead of the one.  Or at least an extra alcohol wipe, because I could reuse the stickers.  Doesn't make sense not to have 2 cleaning sets if you have 2 screens.  The listing didn't indicate that only one set of cleaning supplies would come, so I didn't even think that it wouldn't come with two.  Other screen protector sets I've gotten in the past have offered this, and they're not much more in price than this one, if not the same.

title: Compact and sleek 2-in-1 charger
text:
I like that I only need to use one cord to power this up to charge both my AirPods and Apple Watch.
No issues with charging, and its simple 'apple-like' design and compact size makes it the perfect option to keep on my desk without getting in the way of things.

Have had this for a while now and basically still love it.
There is one issue that has happened since I first reviewed this.
The stand does not hold up well and a piece broke off.
I have still been using it and has thought about buying another one but not sure I want to spend more money if the stand is just going to brake again.
The stand still works, because only a piece broke off but it takes away from the look and does not seat as secure when not using it.
Like I said I just have to decide if I want to buy a new one, because what if this happened again?
